author: manfo2021
title: Dev Journey into DID/SSI* Paradigm
description: The change brought about by the DID paradigm is groundbreaking for conventional devs; at this stage practical use cases are not available.

f6_assessments.q0: DID is a new concept and will require extensive training to become a confident developer. Therefore it is always better to have a large number of training courses and materials available in the ecosystem to support the emerging requirement of the developers.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is from Wada Cameroon Hub. WADA is performing some critical roles in the Cardano community, but the state of the Github repo referenced is not very encouraging. However, this is an evolving ecosystem, and everyone is learning. Therefore I believe in the backing of WADA and its associated support structure. The proposers will be able to complete the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The phasing of the project is precise, and the budget is relatively conservative. Creating a curriculum for DID and Atala is technically challenging, and the identity of the principal educator would have enabled ease of evaluation of the proposal. The KPIs are easy to measure; therefore, the proposal is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications:  in my year long work in political organisations I have been both a treasurer of a political organisation and a financial auditor (someone that checks the books of an organisation to verify that all the funds proceedings are in order). Hence, I can bring in some competencies in evaluating the budgets in this category on their credibility and accountability. In addition to this, I'm a catalyst member and CA for quite some while and have generally a good understanding of the different topics of the ecosystem and of how the proposal process works and what good proposals need. The proposal identifies a valid problem regarding DID: the lack of usecases, applications and skills of Developers regarding it. It approaches this problem with a project based dev training which will both help implementing DID into projects and training developers with ist implementation. This will for sure benefit the Cardano ecosystem by both accelerating DID and providing new opportunities for ist developers. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since WADA is a great multiplicator and keeps establishing, and the related business seems serious and credible, it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
WADA are a really active and established part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt they and their project partners will be able to successfully implement this proposal. The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large group as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Well-defined, detailed metrics and an auditable roadmap are presented that define the success of the proposal. A clear, understandable problem description is accompanied by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is in accordance with the challenge fund and it aims to provide lessons of Atala prism and DID to ease the entry point for those who want to learn it.

Education is important and by allowing people to be educated for free they can develop ideas and therefore accelerate cardano blockchain and DID.

Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers are providing their history and curriculum of the teaching program, which I find suitable and reasonable.

Also, team members are introduced in detail and their experience and skill is in accordance with having this proposal successfully implemented.

Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success is explicitly stated so we can check whether they met the planned outcome.

Also, the roadmap is presented with subtasks that we can audit.

In the end, provided KPIs are stated, which I find suitable and ready for audit.

Possibly, it would be nice to have a KPI where we would actually see some increase in DID projects. After all, we aim to increase it by this proposal, correct? 

Rating given 5.

f6_assessments.q0:
Further development of accessible training in Haskell, Plutus and Atala PRISM, especially in a practical context with a great list of partner projects to develop case studies from can only be a good thing. Doing this with an established community hub in Africa is a great way to bring in more people and developers to the community and target the largest growth opportunity we have. 
Wada has hubs in both French and English speaking countries, and project team also speak Italian but no mention of whether the course material will be available in multiple languages, I think this would be worth additional funding/future proposal if it is not already intended. 
All partner projects are proposed by Wada and there is a chance that only using examples from within one team of developers there is an echo chamber effect and doesn't include a variety of ways to address a solution and potentially lessens the quality of the materials
KPIs chosen give clear assessment of success/impact of the course materials.
f6_assessments.q1:
Established community hub with experienced developers. The plan intends to use some material already established from Haskell courses and Plutus program. Partner projects is a great way to include practical examples in teaching PRISM/DID and all proposed partner projects are proposed by Wada as well this would be nicely synergistic. Potential issues with this approach are that not all/not enough of the partner projects get funded or there are delays in the other projects leading to delays in building course materials from them. All partner projects are also fund 7. 
Time scales to complete the work but there is a possible risk as mentioned that the schedule is shifted if partner projects are delayed. 
Budget seems appropriate for this activity.
My technical knowledge is a little lacking but proposed curriculum appears sensible.
f6_assessments.q2: Good KPIs chosen to easily asses reach and success of program. 3-12 month roadmap beyond course material completion is also simple to assess.

solution: Design and implement project based dev training curriculum to allow developers to learn through creating real solutions that integrate DID.
experience: Wada Cameroon Hub: 3 Haskell/Closure/Java Senior Software Engineers and Architects (12+ years teaching experience) passionate about DID/SSI*
